TopicTitle: How many times did you forget to assign kerbals in a spaceship?

Articles.Content:
I always forget it and ends up with Jeb sitting in there. This is painful in combination with tourist contracts. I even launched a rocket and found out that Jeb is just sitting in there. Alone.

Doyou have similar experiences?
Almost always. It's a big pain, too.
Yep. Somehow the crew are always the last thing I completely forget to select in the VAB, and then I have to go back and sort them out.
Jeb just sneaks into all of my capsules.

I more often forget to remove them from my ships, especially when I send something unmanned but with free seats inside.

Worst scenario happened when I was already in orbit and realized that Jeb shouldn't be on board.

In the career save before my current one Jeb snuck in one time too many.

I gave him a permanent assignment monitoring comms in a high polar orbit ...

4 hours ago, dangerhamster said:

Tsk tsk, don't drink and fly ...
Almost as many times as I have forgotten to empty the capsule of an orbital rescue ship.

When I get unwelcome hitchhikers I often forcefully eject them on the launchpad, this leads to a long tumble down the side of the rocket to the ground then they have to stand in the plume of the launching rocket as punishment. It doesn't learn them tho, they still do it again.

Changing your root module to something not a command capsule will affect crew placement, as well.  An example being if you select a hitchhiker module as the root and you have a drone core included, the game will consider the command capsules as secondary and not needed to be crewed.

If you can get in the habit of checking staging before launch, you can also check crew assignments.

I used to get bitten by this, all the time.  Forget to assign kerbals.  Or forget to unassign them, and only discover that Jeb has stowed away in the command pod when the hapless rescuee is clinging to the ladder and hammering on the door to get in.

Rage-inducing, every time.  Eventually it happened enough so that I got sufficiently annoyed that I wrote a mod so that it would never ever happen to me again.

Ever.

I've started clicking on the launchpad rather than the VAB to start missions,  partly since it shows crew assignments without the need to click the little button in the corner.  Unfortunately, I am so trained to click the VAB I often forget,  and I often want to make a little tweak to the existing design.
